item.title: World steel production
item.description: Time series data: Steel production world (millions metric tons) Source for data: World Steel Association tail(dsts,10) ## Time Series: ## Start = 2010 ## End = 2019 ## Frequency = 1 ## year production ## 2010 2010 1433 ## 2011 2011 1538 ## 2012 2012 1560 ## 2013 2013 1650 ## 2014 2014 1671 ## 2015 2015 1622 ## 2016 2016 1629 ## 2017 2017 1732 ## 2018 2018 1817 ## 2019 2019 1869

item.title: World steel production and capacity
item.description: Time series data: Steel production and steel capacity world (millions metric tons) Source for production data: World Steel Association Source for capacity data: OECD knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE) pkgs = c("readr", "tidyxl", "tidyverse", "unpivotr", "devtools", "data.table", "dplyr", "magrittr", "forcats", "rattle", "forecast") #package names: readr for import as tibble; data.table for fast csv save; tidyverse for operations using dplyr's piping feature; rattle for format tibble column names; magrittr %<>% function pipes left hand data to right side and returns result to left hand overwriting original contents on left hand install.

item.title: Learning R - Rice
item.description: Conclusions Estimated farmer pretax in India of around US$84 per 20 foot container of shipped rough raw rice. That represents a 78% reduction in take home pretax profit since start of 2020 when estimated pretax stood at US$340/container. Despite some increase in price since the start of 2020 farming profitability has fallen sharply. Trigger to enquiry Article in Economic Times of India (accessed: 2020-05-12) that reported today that Basmati rice exporters are suffering from higher shipping costs as a result of lack of containers.
